adjective.description: Of or belonging to the air; aerial, airlike. Now rare.
Of weather: cool, fresh, breezy, chilly. Now chiefly Scottish and United States regional (southern and south Midland).
Conceited, snobbish; inclined to behave in an affected manner. Compare "airy". Now chiefly United States regional (southern and Midland, especially in African-American usage).

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Geoffrey Chaucer (c1340–1400), poet and administrator. From air + -ish.
